result.execSummary:
The defendant James K. Danielczak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James K. Danielczak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James K. Danielczak was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James K. Danielczak

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:20pm
State appears by ADA D. Toldt; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Lawson


Parties state agreement to sentencing recommendation, and reasoning for recommendation.

COURT ORDERS: $5+CC; NO DNA issues to be addressed.

Adj: 2:22pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentencing hearing on October 1, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:40 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Richard Lawson.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed. VRCW.
State makes recommendation. Ct.1 previously dismissed. 
PLEA: Ct.2-Disorderly Conduct>>GUILTY 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: Sentencing Hearing to be set within 6 months. Bond to continue. 
Adj: 9:45 a.m.
Plea hearing on April 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
and Demand for Discovery & Inspection - State's
Pre-trial conference on February 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:17 am 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt; Deft appears in person with Atty Richard Lawson. 

DEFT'S MOTION FOR DISMISSAL. 
Atty Lawson notes deft's motion for dismissal. COURT notes that motion has not yet made it to the court file and should be heard later. State notes motion for dismissal needs to be addressed prior to preliminary hearing. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT denies motion. 

PRELIMINARY HEARING. 
Officer Kou Moua (EMPD) sworn and testifies. Atty Lawson stipulates to indentification of the deft. 
State requests matter be continued to allow victim to be brought in to testify. Atty Lawson objects. Argument. 
COURT denies motion to continue. 
COURT makes findings - finds there is NO probable cause. 
COURT dismisses Ct. 1. 
COURT notes Ct. 2 remains. 

Dates set: PTC on 2/5/2015 at 9am with Br. 2 JA. 
Bond:  Continued
Adj: 9:40 am 

C: Br. 2
to Dismiss Criminal Complaint (Count One) - stj

Final pre-trial on February 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing on January 20, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

No contact with victim(s):  K.M.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No alcohol.  Absolute sobriety.
